title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: This Global 500 energy CEO says the model for the global corporation that worked for 20 years is obsolete—here’s what he’s building instead
items.description: In a wide-ranging interview with Fortune, Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum, lays out his vision for his vast enterprise.

items.title: Ray Dalio says his AI clone will be able to give you investment and career insights whenever you want
items.description: Ray Dalio has a waitlist for “Digital Ray,” an AI clone designed to talk to the public.

items.title: Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum credits his time as CHRO for shaping his leadership style: Success is ‘90% about the people you put in the job’
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: Can Europe find the political energy to become competitive again?
items.description: “Europe is not just a beautiful idea; it’s a powerful and stable economic space. And that’s what we want to preserve," says Stéphane Séjourné.

items.title: Sam Altman’s OpenAI is coming for Wall Street’s grunt workers as AI continues to transform the entry level
items.description: Experts say automation of low-level tasks in finance will “transform” rather than “eliminate” roles on Wall Street.
